overview: Noah is an entrepreneur with experience in consumer internet, mobile technology, media, and business intelligence. He is co-founder of Dwelleo Inc., a web and mobile platform for communicating with neighbors, businesses and professionals around your home. Noah is also a director at OmniTrail Technologies, which develops and commercializes technology that enables indoor location, proximity detection and machine-to-machine communication for mobile devices. Previously, Noah was an associate at private equity firm KP Capital Partners, where he led the execution of controlling investments in a number of companies where he also coordinated efforts to restructure debt, cut costs and refocus strategy. While at KP, Noah served on the boards of portfolio companies Krell Industries, Nu-Wathne Holdings, Wathne USA and Wathne Overseas, and was board observer to Inteco International Trade. Prior to that, Noah was part of the founding team at business intelligence firm ChinaLaw and worked as a journalist and editor in Beijing and Washington, D.C. for several media and business intelligence companies. Noah holds an MBA from the University of Virginia’s Darden School of Business and a BA from Tufts University.
